title.rendered: 10 Best SketchUp Courses to Take in 2023

content.rendered:
3D modeling is cool. I mean, just imagine seeing your dream building come to life without laying a single brick, or maybe that floor lamp you want to put beside your couch but you just haven’t found the right design yet. Why not visualize your imagination with SketchUp – the popular 3D modeling software?

In this guide, I’ve selected the 10 best free and paid SketchUp online courses for you from the 100+ SketchUp courses on our catalog by following a well-defined methodology that you can find below.

But if you want to jump straight to the results, here are my top 10 picks. You can click on a course to jump to the corresponding section:

Course Workload In Brief
1. SketchUp 2021 Essential Training (LinkedIn Learning) 2-3 hours Best course for beginners to learn the foundations of SketchUp with practice opportunities
2. Learning SketchUp Free (LinkedIn Learning) 3-4  hours Great course for beginners to learn the basics and advanced concepts of SketchUp Free
3. SketchUp for Architecture (LinkedIn Learning) 5-6 hours Intermediate-level course for architects to master 3D building modeling in SketchUp
4. The Complete Sketchup & Vray Course for Interior Design (Udemy) 7 hours Beginner-friendly course to learn 3D modeling in Sketchup, Vray and Photoshop
5. SketchUp Pro: Interior Design Detailing (LinkedIn Learning) 3-4 hours Intermediate-level course for experienced users to master interior design in SketchUp Pro
6. SketchUp Free Tutorials (Online Version) (TheSketchUpEssentials) 2-3 hours Best free course for beginners to learn the basics of SketchUp using SketchUp Free
7. Introducción a SketchUp (Domestika) 6-7 hours Great course for beginners to learn 3D modeling in SketchUp from scratch in Spanish
8. Using SketchUp Pro? Watch These (SketchUp School) 2-3 hours Free course for beginners to learn the basics of SketchUp Pro for 3D modeling
9. SketchUp Free 2022 – All you need to know! (Udemy) 4-5 hours Project-based course for beginners to learn the essential concepts of SketchUp
10. Learn SketchUp Pro 2021 the Right Way! (Udemy) 7-8 hours Long, beginner-friendly course to learn to 3D model a living room in SketchUp Pro

What is SketchUp?

SketchUp is a 3D modeling and rendering software that has a wide range of drawing and design applications in the fields of architecture, interior design, product design, civil and mechanical engineering, video game development, and many more. It even allows you to place your models within Google Earth.

SketchUp was originally developed by @Last Software in 2000, which was later acquired by Google in 2006. A number of newer versions of the software came out before SketchUp was yet again acquired by its current owner, Trimble Navigation (now Trimble Inc.), in 2012.

You can try different versions of SketchUp according to your needs including a free, web-based one that comes with the essential features of the software.

Why are SketchUp Skills Important?

SketchUp is named the #1 architecture software program in the world by G2’s Grid Report for Architecture, Summer 2022. 

According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, the median annual wage for drafters was $60,290 in May 2021 while their employment is projected to grow 3% from 2021 to 2031, with about 18,900 openings projected each year, on average, over the decade.

The requirements for this job is complete high school education, CAD and SketchUp skills. Moreover, there are nearly 18,000 job openings for Drafters on Indeed.com. Clearly, having SketchUp in your skillset is a plus when it comes to employability.

What is My Experience with SketchUp?

I first came to know about SketchUp from the Guided Project, Product Design: Designing a modern table lamp using SketchUp. I took it back in 2020 and I made (as the name suggests) a 3D table lamp. Thinking about it now as a civil engineer, I can see SketchUp has quite some good applications in the construction and architecture domain as well.

Besides that, I am a Guided Project Instructor and a Beta Tester at Coursera, having tested many courses before they’re officially launched. I have taken over 50 online courses in various subjects.

My experience as an online learner and teacher has given me some perspective on what to look for in an online course. I used my experience to evaluate each course in this list.

Course Ranking Methodology

I built this ranking following the now tried-and-tested methodology I used in previous rankings (you can find them all here). It involves a three-step process:

  1. Research: I started by leveraging Class Central’s database with 100K online courses and 200K+ reviews. Then, I made a preliminary selection of 100+ SketchUp courses by rating, reviews, and bookmarks.
  2. Evaluate: I read through reviews on Class Central, Reddit, and course providers to understand what other learners thought about each course and combined it with my own experience as a learner.
  3. Select: Well-made courses were picked if they presented valuable and engaging content and they have to fit in a set of criteria and be ranked accordingly: comprehensive curriculum, release date, affordability, ratings and enrollments.

The end result is a unique selection of courses that combines a decade of Class Central data and my own experience as an online learner to try to get the best of both worlds. So far, I’ve spent more than 10 hours building this list, and I’ll continue to update it.

Course Ranking Statistics

Here are some statistics regarding this course ranking:

  • Combined, these courses have accrued over 128.7K enrollments.
  • 2 courses are free or free-to-audit and 8 courses are paid.
  • The most-represented course provider in the ranking is LinkedIn Learning, with 4 courses.
  • 9 courses are in English, and 1 course is in Spanish.
  • The SketchUp subject is followed by over 2.1K learners on Class Central, and accounts for over 100 courses in Class Central catalog.

So without further ado, let’s get to my picks for the best SketchUp online courses.

1. SketchUp 2021 Essential Training (LinkedIn Learning)

My first pick for the best SketchUp online course is SketchUp 2021 Essential Training on LinkedIn Learning.

Designed for beginners, this course will help you grasp the basics of SketchUp with just a couple of hours. You’ll get a foundational understanding of SketchUp, learn to use its drawing and design tools, and apply simple styles and animation. What’s more – you’ll also get enough practice opportunities throughout the course to test your understanding.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll explore the SketchUp interface. You’ll choose a template, learn the basics for using a Windows and Mac interface, customize the toolbar for Mac, use the axis, standard camera views and zoom tools, move the camera view with Orbit and Pan tools, set a camera view and the Look Around tool, and walk around the model.

In the second module, you’ll manipulate objects. You’ll use the Select tool and the Move tool, create copies and an array, resize an object, rotate an object, flip and mirror an object, and learn about the 3D Warehouse and why polygons matter.

In the third module, you’ll draw in SketchUp. You’ll use the Line tool, Rectangle tool, Circle tool, Push/Pull into 3D, Tape Measure tool, Protractor tool, Undo and let go, Eraser tool, Dividing lines, and Offset tool.

In the fourth module, you’ll model from a floor plan image. You’ll import and prep, draw a floor plan, extrude walls, and add doorways and windows.

In the fifth module, you’ll learn about organization. You’ll make groups, make components, isolate a group or component, use Tags and Entity Info, and the Outliner window.

In the sixth module, you’ll learn about materials. You’ll apply material using a Mac, edit material using a Mac, apply material using Windows, edit material using Windows, apply material using 3D Warehouse, import and apply a custom texture, and purge material list.

Finally, in the seventh module, you’ll document and stylize. You’ll set shadows and fog, change the style, set and update scenes, check edge alignment, create a section cut, dimension, draw dashed lines, label, create 3D text, animate, and export in 2D and 3D.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 7 modules. Each module involves about 15 to 30 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor Tammy Cody
Level Beginner
Workload 2-3 hours
Enrollments 121.5K
Rating 4.8/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Cody is an interior designer and SketchUp trainer who has been teaching SketchUp for 8 over years.
  • She is the founder and instructor at SketchUp for Interior Designers.
  • You can view more of her work here.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

2. Learning SketchUp Free (LinkedIn Learning)

My second pick for the best SketchUp online course is Learning SketchUp Free on LinkedIn Learning.

SketchUp Free is the free, web-based version of the software that contains many of the features found in the paid versions such as SketchUp Pro. If you’re a beginner, this is a great opportunity for you if you want to try your hands at SketchUp and even learn some advanced techniques before moving to the paid versions if you want.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll explore the SketchUp Free interface. You’ll learn about interface basics, opening files from Trimble Connect, inserting files, loading components via 3D Warehouse, navigating in SketchUp, and walking around in SketchUp.

You’ll also learn about standard camera views, display shadows and fog, creating multiple views using scenes, applying styles and modeling info window, and solve a challenge on scenes and styles.

In the second module, you’ll draw in SketchUp. You’ll understand the Line tool fundamentals, 3D drawing with the Line tool, using the Rectangle tool, creating rotated rectangles, pushing and pulling faces in 3D and using the Eraser tool, and solve a challenge on basic drawing.

In the third module, you’ll work on advanced drawing. You’ll learn about drawing curved and freehand shapes, creating circles and polygons, softening and smoothing edges, creating outlines with Offset, using the Follow Me tool and creating 3D text, and solve a challenge on advanced drawing.

In the fourth module, you’ll manipulate objects. You’ll explore selecting and moving objects, scaling and rotating objects, manipulating faces and edges and duplicating objects, and solve a challenge on drawing with duplication.

In the fifth module, you’ll learn about staying organized. You’ll understand grouping objects, creating components, component options, working with layers and entity info, and solve a challenge on components and groups.

In the sixth module, you’ll measure and label. You’ll use the Tape Measure tool and the Protractor tool, Creating labels with the Text tool, dimension, create cutaways using section planes, and solve a challenge on drawing with guides.

In the seventh module, you’ll learn about materials and textures. You’ll apply materials, create materials from textures, adjust texture placement, map curved objects, import images, and solve a challenge on adding materials.

Finally, in the eighth module, you’ll import and export. You’ll download SketchUp files, and export to 2D and 3D formats.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 8 modules. Each module involves about 15 to 40 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor George Maestri
Level Beginner
Workload 3-4  hours
Enrollments 122.1K
Rating 4.8/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Maestri is an animation and computer graphics professional, writer, director, producer and educator.
  • He has written, directed, produced, and animated for Nickelodeon, Warner Bros, Disney and Comedy Central.
  • He has also created hundreds of hours of original online educational content for Lynda.com and LinkedIn Learning.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

3. SketchUp for Architecture (LinkedIn Learning)

My third pick for the best SketchUp online course is SketchUp for Architecture on LinkedIn Learning.

Are you an architect looking to create cool CAD models of buildings using SketchUp? Then this intermediate-level course is a must for you. Right from designing the site plan to adding walls, floors, roof and even furniture and appliances, this course will take you through the whole process of transforming simple drawings into 3D presentations.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll be introduced to the course. You’ll understand what you should know before watching this course, and how to use the exercise files.

In the second module, you’ll set up SketchUp. You’ll learn about templates, toolbars, and model settings, moving around the model, understanding and creating components, saving and loading components, and what plugins are and where to find them.

In the third module, you’ll see how to work with SketchUp, not against it. You’ll learn to think like SketchUp, explore sweeps and revolves, inferencing and X-ray, groups, components and the Outliner window, and organize your model with layers and scenes.

In the fourth module, you’ll model the house. You’ll be introduced to modeling the house, and learn about importing 2D CAD drawings, adding the base, building the external shell, shaping the external shell slopes (Pro and Make methods), forming the openings and high-level window openings, add internal walls, low-level doors and window, and high-level windows (front and side face), and adding the roof.

In the fifth module, you’ll work with materials. You’ll be introduced to working with materials, the Materials Editor (Windows and Mac interfaces), apply materials to objects, import images as textures, create textures from scratch (Windows and Mac), add materials to walls, roofs, doors and windows, and modify the material placement.

In the sixth module, you’ll explore landscaping and external features. You’ll be introduced to landscaping, and add the hardstanding, walls, wall coping, water feature, stepping-stones, path edge and infill, grass, grass border and external planting.

In the seventh module, you’ll create interior furnishings. You’ll be introduced to modeling the interior fixtures, add the chimney stack, create the fire pit and the island unit, build the low units, high units and left-side kitchen units, and add the pelmet and base trim.

You’ll also add the work surface, drop in the sink top, add the cooker and hood, add the fridge, decorate the west-wing interior, and load the furniture and finishes.

In the eighth module, you’ll style the model. You’ll be introduced to styling the model, use the style window, create and save a new style, add a watermark, and use styles for section cuts.

In the ninth module, you’ll learn about scenes. You’ll be introduced to scenes, the scene window, and create the elevation scenes, plans and sections, and Perspective views with shadows.

Finally, you’ll geolocate the model. You’ll learn about the importance of accurately locating the model, mapping the shadows to the views, and animating a simple shadow study.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 10 modules. Each module involves about 25 minutes to 1 hour of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor Paul J. Smith
Level Intermediate
Workload 5-6 hours
Enrollments 291.4K
Rating 4.8/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Smith is an experienced BIM (building information modeling) lecturer who has worked in the higher education industry.
  • He is skilled in AutoCAD, CAD (computer-aided design), Revit, sustainable design, and sketching.
  • He has a Bachelor of Arts (BA) degree in Interior Architecture from the University of Wales, Cardiff.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

4. The Complete Sketchup & Vray Course for Interior Design (Udemy)

My fourth pick for the best SketchUp online course is The Complete Sketchup & Vray Course for Interior Design on Udemy.

Whether you are an interior designer, architect, engineer or simply a hobbyist, this course will teach you all about modeling, rendering and post-production with Sketchup, Vray and Photoshop within 7 hours. It is hands-on and consists of 6 projects to model the different rooms of a house such as bedroom and kitchen.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn the core Sketchup skills required to model better, how to use certain Sketchup plugins to take your modeling skills to the next level, Vray lighting, materials, settings, render elements and more to create amazing photorealistic renders.

You’ll also model and render a real-life contemporary bedroom, furniture, modular kitchen, learn about interior design standards and styles to design a space functionally and efficiently, and use Sketchup plugins to create blankets, pillows, curtains and more.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 14 sections. Each section involves about 1.5 to 3.5 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and quizzes. Downloadable resources are also provided.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Manish Paul Simon
Level Beginner
Workload 7 hours
Enrollments 21.5K
Rating 4.5/5.0 (3K)
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Simon is an architect, 3D artist, author and architectural consultant from Bangalore, India.
  • He graduated from the School of Planning & Architecture, Vijayawada, India.
  • He is the founder of Sketchup Guru and the host of a podcast show, Archgyan Podcast.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

5. SketchUp Pro: Interior Design Detailing (LinkedIn Learning)

My fifth pick for the best SketchUp online course is SketchUp Pro: Interior Design Detailing on LinkedIn Learning.

If you are already experienced in using SketchUp Pro, then this intermediate-level course is for you. You’ll create an interior design in SketchUp Pro right from the floor plan, build it up three dimensionally, add furniture and fixtures, and finally document the design for your clients. Some familiarity with AutoCAD is helpful but not required.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll learn about the project setup and organization. You’ll import AutoCAD drawings, import photos as drawing references, create walls, use tags, import other SketchUp models, create door and window openings, and set the scene.

In the second module, you’ll create and import objects. You’ll create a basic kitchen, use the 3D warehouse, place objects in a model, model a basic sofa from scratch, use extensions to add realistic details, explore 3D model websites, and create ceiling elements.

In the third module, you’ll add lighting and materials. You’ll place light fixtures, add background images, import images as textures, apply Material Replacer and Component Replacer, and add realism.

Finally, you’ll create 2D drawings. You’ll explore the floor plan view, furniture plan view and reflected ceiling plan, and export drawings to scale.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 4 modules. Each module involves about 30 minutes to 1.5 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor Rebecca Terpstra
Level Intermediate
Workload 3-4 hours
Enrollments 94.6K
Rating 4.7/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Terpstra is the interior design program chair at Arapahoe Community College, Colorado.
  • She loves teaching SketchUp 3D modeling, CAD-based software and interior design.
  • Her areas of expertise include instructional design, SU Podium rendering, space planning, residential and commercial design, procurement, site measuring, and more.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

6. SketchUp Free Tutorials (Online Version) (TheSketchUpEssentials)

My sixth pick for the best SketchUp online course is the free course SketchUp Free Tutorials (Online Version), offered by TheSketchUpEssentials on YouTube.

Within a matter of only a couple of hours, you’ll learn all the basics of SketchUp you need to know in order to make a 3D house model. Moreover, you’ll be using the free, web-based version of SketchUp, SketchUp Free, for this course and work from creating the floor plan all the way up to rendering your 3D model. And it’s all free!

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll create a house model. You’ll work with components, copies and curves, materials in the online version, free models from the 3D Warehouse, create floor plans from images, change units, add doors and windows to a floor plan, print from the web version, import and use images, and render models.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 11 videos. Each video involves about 5 to 20 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Channel TheSketchUpEssentials
Provider YouTube
Instructor Justin Geis
Level Beginner
Workload 2-3 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • The SketchUpEssentials YouTube channel has over 427K subscribers and gives weekly SketchUp lessons and tutorials.
  • Geis is the founder of The SketchUp Essentials and the SketchUp Essentials YouTube Channel.
  • He started using SketchUp as part of his work as a general contractor in 2008.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

7. Introducción a SketchUp (Domestika)

My seventh pick for the best SketchUp online course is Introducción a SketchUp on Domestika.

From conceptual design to the final model, in this Spanish course, you’ll learn from scratch how to design and model in 3D quickly and efficiently. By the end of this course, you would’ve mastered the tools and techniques of SketchUp so that you can create your own 3D models and visualizations quickly and easily.

What You’ll Learn

First, you’ll learn about navigating the model, the importance of the point of view, the first strokes, go from flat surface to volume, measurement tools, keyboard shortcuts, modeling practice, the Rectangle tool, Polygons and Circles, the Move tool, and creating groups and rotating.

Then, you’ll understand copying and copy modes, the component entity, scale factor and symmetry, the Follow Me tool, the Outline window, components with aperture and fixed to a plane, camera-oriented components, and creating and managing component libraries.

Next, you’ll explore the large component library, 3D Warehouse, importing models in other formats, solid groups and components, modeling with scale and solids, applying default materials, creating a material from scratch, texture mapping, and creation and management of material collections.

After that, you’ll learn about adapting photos with a single point of view and multiple points of view, selection of graphic styles, customizing graphic styles, combining schema and layers, section cuts, shadows and geolocation, and scene creation and management.

Finally, you’ll get a virtual tour and animations, and learn about exporting to 2D and 3D formats, extensions, what they are and how to install them, a very useful extension, TrueBend and modeling practice.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 52 lessons. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, additional resources and practice exercises.

Provider Domestika
Instructor Alejandro Soriano
Level Beginner
Workload 6-7 hours
Enrollments 77.2K
Rating 100% (2.4K)
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Soriano is a freelance designer specialized in 3D visualization.
  • He produces images and illustrations of objects, buildings and environments.
  • He has worked for clients such as RBA and National Geographic.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

8. Using SketchUp Pro? Watch These (SketchUp School)

My eighth pick for the best SketchUp online course is the free course Using SketchUp Pro? Watch These, offered by SketchUp School on YouTube.

This beginner-friendly course will teach you how to model in 3D using SketchUp Pro. It covers all the basic utilities of SketchUp Pro that you need to know in order to get started with 3D modeling in SketchUp, especially to model a room in 3D. And it’s all free!

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll create a floor plan, measure and model a room, turn 2D floor plans into 3D models, use LayOut for SketchUp Pro, render, Vray for SketchUp vs Lumion, SketchUp extensions, and model hard things.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 10 videos. Each video involves about 5 to 15 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Institution SketchUp School
Provider YouTube
Instructor Alex Oliver
Level Beginner
Workload 2-3 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • The SketchUp School YouTube channel has over 234K subscribers and shares monthly SketchUp lessons and tutorials.
  • Oliver has also created SketchUp: The Definitive Guide to Getting Started.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

9. SketchUp Free 2022 – All you need to know! (Udemy)

My ninth pick for the best SketchUp online course is SketchUp Free 2022 – All you need to know! on Udemy.

This project-based course for beginners will teach you all you need to know in order to get started with SketchUp Free, the free, web-based version of SketchUp. You’ll not just explore the essential tools and techniques for 3D modeling, you’ll actually learn by doing.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn important tools and functions to start your own projects in SketchUp, the difference between groups and components, build professional models, and find models and textures using the 3D model library.

You’ll also take a look at useful SketchUp hacks and tricks that save you time and enable you to create special shapes and geometries, and import models, edit them and present them in an appealing way.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 14 sections. Each section involves about 15 to 30 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and downloadable resources.

Provider Udemy
Level Beginner
Workload 4-5 hours
Rating 4.7/5.0
Certificate Paid

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

10. Learn SketchUp Pro 2021 the Right Way! (Udemy)

My tenth pick for the best SketchUp online course is Learn SketchUp Pro 2021 the Right Way! on Udemy.

Learn the fundamentals of SketchUp Pro as well as good 3D modeling habits with the longest SketchUp course on this list. Aimed towards beginners, this course shows you how to create a living room from scratch, complete with walls, doors, windows and more.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll go over the fundamental tools as well as setup of the template and toolbars, build a simple interior living room space and develop the model into a document, create a living room space. bring up walls, and push out door and window openings.

You’ll also learn how to create groups, components and place furniture, add textures and materials, import images, colors and artwork, add details like trim and baseboards, and use tags to adjust the visibility of objects and create scenes.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 10 sections. Each section involves about 30 minutes to 1 hour of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and downloadable resources.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Daniel Brown
Level Beginner
Workload 7-8 hours
Enrollments 6K
Rating 4.6/5.0 (1.4K)
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Brown has been a designer, 3D modeling specialist and SketchUp trainer since receiving his Architecture degree in 2007.
  • He served as a SketchUp trainer at Google prior to starting SketchUpTrainer.
  • He has worked with Starbucks and Target, and also teaches an interior design course at Harcum College.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.
